summary: Build a luxury, modern, responsive marketing website for the premium Indian spices brand “Spice Lux” (cardamom & black pepper) targeting retail/wholesale/export, using a static HTML + Tailwind CSS + JavaScript stack with SEO-friendly, fast-loading pages and WhatsApp enquiry integration.
architectural_notes: Tech stack chosen: static site using HTML5 + Tailwind CSS + JavaScript (no React).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Premium spice hero photograph in a luxury editorial style with warm dramatic lighting (spice-lux-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
- Close-up premium green cardamom pods product photograph on a dark matte background with gold accents (product-cardamom.dim_800x600.png)
- Close-up premium black peppercorns product photograph on a dark matte background with gold accents (product-black-pepper.dim_800x600.png)
- Minimal luxury line icon: export/shipping motif in gold on transparent background (icon-export-quality.dim_128x128.png)
- Minimal luxury line icon: handpicked/leaf motif in gold on transparent background (icon-handpicked.dim_128x128.png)
- Minimal luxury line icon: hygiene/sealed-pack motif in gold on transparent background (icon-hygienically-packed.dim_128x128.png)

existing_features.title: Create the Spice Lux responsive marketing website UI in React + TypeScript with Tailwind styling, implementing the requested sections/pages: Home (hero with headline “Spice Lux – Luxury You Can Taste”, CTAs: Order Now / Bulk Enquiry / Contact Us, and 3 feature callouts: Export Quality | Handpicked | Hygienically Packed), About Spice Lux, Products (two product cards), Why Choose Spice Lux, Testimonials, and Contact.

Apply a consistent luxury brand visual theme using the provided palette (deep red, matte black, gold highlights, natural green accents), including typography, spacing, and component styling (buttons, cards, navbar) suitable for a premium Indian spices brand.
Implement a sticky navbar with clear links to the main sections (Home, About, Products, Why Choose, Testimonials, Contact), including a responsive mobile menu.

Build the Products section/page with two product cards (Green Cardamom and Black Pepper) featuring elegant hover effects and including: image, short description (use the provided suggested descriptions), available grades/weights, and an “Enquire Now” button for each product.
Implement WhatsApp “Order Now” integration: clicking the Order Now / enquiry CTAs opens WhatsApp with a prefilled message that references Spice Lux and (when applicable) the selected product.
Create the Contact section/page including a contact form, displayed phone number and email, a WhatsApp “Order Now” button, and a Google Maps location embed.
Persist Contact form submissions to the Motoko canister (single-actor backend) via a dedicated submission method and expose a query method to verify saved submissions during development/testing.
Add smooth, lightweight animations and SEO-friendly structure (semantic headings, meta title/description, accessible landmarks) while keeping the site fast-loading.
Organize the project with a clean folder structure and production-ready, readable code with concise comments where helpful (especially around WhatsApp integration and form submission flow).
Add generated static image assets for the hero and products under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the Home hero and Products cards (do not serve images from the backend).
